content: As someone who was lucky enough to be taught both map types (as well as a physical globe) at any early age (thank God for my Mom and homeschooling), I can tell you that kids love real globes. I loved spinning the globe, feeling its raised elevation areas, etc. — just include a globe in every classroom and mention the different map types. The globe is the most accurate presentation, and it is the most fun for kids. No need for a computer, either.
